poem.content:
On the island, a dizzying heat,
The noble project, bitter and sweet.
Front and center, a culture's slow sway,
Betray always lurks, come what may.

The final process, a narrow gate,
Towards an aim I can't quite state.
An asset lost, like pudding in sand,
Wasted potential, no helping hand.

A toilet's cold porcelain gleam,
Reflecting back a shattered dream.
Always the echo, a hollow sound,
Where promises crumbled on barren ground.

Narrowing vision, the island recedes,
Planting dark future's desperate seeds.
Noble intentions, now twisted and strange,
Left to wander, in desolate range.

Dizzy and lost, in culture's decay,
Betray a constant, come what may.
The project falters, its purpose unclear,
Facing the final asset loss I always fear.
